description: Ensure trash/debris (U) is removed from floors.
Tile floors must be dusted, swept, and mopped (D).
Carpet must be vacuumed (U).
Sinks will be clean, free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W). Sink closest to entry door is for Pos 1&4; opposing sink for Pos 2&3.
Display drain plug in the up position (I).
(Optional) Rubber stoppers will be grounded (G) to the right side (I) of the faucet.

(Optional) Drinking cups/glasses must be clean (D) and serviceable (N). Grounded left (Pos 1&2) or right (Pos 3&4) of faucet, grounded to the back wall, and either to the corner or flush with sink edge.
(Optional) Only 1 hand soap per sink will be grounded (G) to the left side (I) of the faucet.
Soap Tray and Toothbrush Holder chrome will be clean (D), free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W). No items authorized on soap tray or toothbrush holder.
The sink cabinet must be neatly arranged. Doors will be closed when not in use (I). Authorized items: Storage Bin/Toiletry bag, toiletries, laundry supplies, air fresheners (4 hangers max).
The cabinet, authorized items, and optional storage bins will be clean (D), free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W).
Hangers (4 max) neatly stacked, upright, and grounded to a wall. Pos 1&2 ground storage bin/toiletry bag to left side of cabinet against hangers. Pos 3&4 ground bin/bag to right side against hangers.
Items will be sized tallest to shortest from left to right (S), with no break at the center, regardless of the number of occupants.
Items in cabinet will be clean (D/U). Pos 1&2 use bottom shelf area; Pos 3&4 use top shelf area. The middle shelf is shared.
Mirrors will be clean, free of dust, debris, and smudges (D/U).
Items will stand upright unless the container or shape does not allow (I).
Items will be sized tallest to shortest from left to right (S).
The entire surface and bowl will be cleaned (D/U).
Toilet seat and lid must be in the up position (I).
(Optional) Rack behind toilet may have up to two extra rolls of toilet paper.
(Optional) You may have an additional wastebasket in the latrine, long side grounded to the wall and short side flushed with the doorframe.
The shower will be clean and free of soap scum (D), mold, dirt, hair (U), etc.
The shower door will be left open (I). All toiletries will be stored in the sink cabinet.
(Optional) Squeegee may be displayed inside the shower, grounded to corner of shower floor (G), nearest the hinge side of the shower door.
(Optional) A bathmat or towel may be in the shower, grounded to the base of the shower and centered (G). If a towel is used, it must be draped over the shower door neatly when not in use.
(Optional) Wet Uniform Items (PTG): Jacket/Pants hung on a hanger on shower frame. Shoes placed inside shower. Gloves on rack above toilet. Underwear/socks stowed in laundry bag.
Towels will not be stained or heavily soiled (D), must be serviceable (N), and may be wet but must not drip water.
Fold towel in half lengthwise (F). Drape evenly (I) over towel rack. Ground the single folds to the brackets (G) with open edges towards the center.
Position 1 & 4 share bottom rack; 2 & 3 share top. Pos 1/2 ground fold to bracket near entry door; Pos 3/4 ground fold to bracket farthest from entry door.
Towels may be wet but must not drip water onto the floor. (Duplicate: see common_area_towel_001)
Fold and drape washcloth same as towel (F/G/I) on towel or rack. Flush single fold of washcloth with towel's single fold. (Luffa: place in open ziplock bag in sink cabinet).
Serviceable (D/N/U), damp is ok. Fold/drape same as large towel. On towel bar next to sink: Pos 1&2 ground fold toward bathroom door; Pos 3&4 ground fold toward mirror.
Iron cord will be neatly wrapped (I). Iron and ironing board will be dust free (D/U) and neatly displayed in closet. Iron will be free of water when displayed (W).
Iron cord will be neatly wrapped (I). Iron and ironing board will be dust free (D/U) and neatly displayed in closet.
The wastebasket must be lined with a trash bag (A). A single, unused liner may be placed under the active liner.
Trash bag must be empty and free of debris (U). No trash, dust, or debris under the liner.
Display on the wall nearest Occupant 1â€™s desk, grounding the long side to the wall (G/I). The short side will be flush with the corner of the wall (G/I).
Windows, blinds, and drapes will be down and closed to conserve energy (I).
All blinds, curtains, and ledges will be free of debris and dusted daily (D/U).
Hanging mirrors will be clean and free of debris (U), spots, and streaks (D).
Will be clean and dust free (D/U) and in serviceable working condition (N).
Center the lamp on the dressers between the two beds (H). Lamp shade will be grounded to the wall (G).
All bed items must be clean, dry, serviceable. Inspection side is closest to door. Head of bed is nearest the wall.
Bed rails must be clean and dust free.
Fitted or bottom sheet placed neatly over mattress ensuring it is tight, neat and wrinkle free.
Make hospital corners on inspection side. If comforter is wide enough, make on both sides; otherwise, tuck excess on non-inspection side.
Ensure the comforter and sheet are tight, neat, and wrinkle free.
(Optional) May be displayed between blue comforter and top sheet, OR neatly folded three times, centered on and flush with the foot end of the mattress.
(Optional) Display neatly folded three times, centered on and flush with the foot end of the mattress or tan blanket. Stack blankets with largest on the bottom.
Ensure pillowcase is right side out, fold excess underneath the pillow.
Pillow is flush with the head end of the mattress and centered on the width. Extra pillows are placed on top, sized largest to smallest.
Center the mattress on the bed frame and ground it to the foot end of bed frame.
Size items on shelves tallest to shortest, left to right. Stack similar items with longest on bottom.
Ensure trash/debris is removed from floors. Floors must be vacuumed.
(Optional) Dry Towel: Drape towel evenly over top bed rail. Ground single fold to the end of the bedrail on the inspection side of the bed.
(Optional) Hand Towel/Wash Cloth: Drape evenly over the dry towel or rail. Ground single fold to the end of the bedrail on the inspection side.
Ensure chairs are free of dust and debris.
The chair will be pushed in and grounded to the side closest to the entry door and front of desk when not in use.
The backpack will be draped over the back of the chair. Hydration system will be draped over the backpack. Zippers and hook and loop will be closed.
All desk/shelf surfaces and interiors must be dry, clean, and dust/debris free. Accoutrements bin: grounded to corner of shelf furthest from entry door.
(Optional) Laptop displayed grounded to back corner and side closest to entry, password protected, open 90Â°. Tower grounded to opposite side of desk, flush with front.
(Optional) Printer will be free of dust and debris. Display on the opposite side of the computer, grounded to the back, desk corner.
(Optional) Items will not be left on the glass and paper will not be in the tray.
(Optional) One picture frame (max 8x10) may be stored on the top shelf, centered, and flush with the front edge.
(Optional) One plastic bin/bag for office supplies is authorized, grounded to the front left corner. Items too large for bin are stored next to it, grounded to the front.
(Optional) Printer paper will be grounded to the front right corner.
All drawer items and interiors must be dry, clean, and free of dust and debris.
All items will be serviceable (i.e., no rips or tears).
Fold PT shorts, T-shirts, and optional form fitting shorts. Ground bottom item to front right corner. Stack with longest on bottom (pyramid effect).
Running socks rolled/folded. Ground first pair to front left corner. Ground subsequent pairs to the rear in a single row. Stack excess directly on top.
Roll socks; upward curve forms a smile facing front. Ground boot socks front-left; low quarters front-right of boot socks. Form rows front-to-back, stack excess in gap.
(Optional) Long johns: fold neatly and ground to back right corner. Stack with longest on bottom (pyramid effect).
Roll T-shirts, hemmed edge down (6 o'clock), open end to rear. OCP shirts in a line from front-left. White T-shirts in a line right of OCPs. Stack excess in gap.
Underwear/Boxers: Ground to front-right, stack largest on bottom, waistband to rear. Bras: under-wire front-left; sport bras back-left; stack largest to smallest, cups up.
Any items stored in the security drawer must present a neat and orderly appearance.
The drawer must be locked when the owning Officer Trainee is not in the room.
Place the properly filled out AETC Form 341 on top of the dresser, centered and flush with the front edge.
Items clean, dry, dust-free, serviceable, shined. Pos 1&4 use closet nearest entry; Pos 2&3 use second. Pos 1&2 use side closest to entry. DCOs display rank on outer garments.
Empty all pockets and remove non-sewn strings/tags. OCPs will not have unsewn patches/tapes. MREs: Box on floor, long end to back wall, short end to entry wall. Pos 3&4 stack on top of 1&2.
Display items as worn (i.e., secure all zippers, hook and loop, and buttons).
OCP Patrol Cap: Display on left side of shelf, as worn. Bill flush with front edge. Ground right side of cap to left wall (or centerline if shared).
Flight Cap: Display right of Patrol Cap, triangle down, front flush with shelf edge. Ground to Patrol Cap. DCOs display rank.
(Optional) Watch Cap: Fold in half left-to-right, edges even. Open end flush with shelf edge. Ground single fold to open side of Flight Cap.
Gloves: Ground thumb side to right wall/dividing line. Open ends flush with each other.
Flashlight: Display left of gloves, grounded to them. If no gloves, ground to wall/partition. Lightbulb end flush with front edge.
Hang items with open-end of hanger to rear. Left sleeve and front of item faces closet door. Outer garments on 2 wire or 1 plastic hanger.
Service dress items will be pressed, neat, and wrinkle-free.
Hangers will be evenly spaced from left to right. Ground end hangers to brackets or dividing line.

Hanger Order (L-R): All-Weather Coat, LW Blue Jacket, Cardigan, Service Coat, LS Blue Shirt, SS Blue Shirt, Blue Trousers, Blues Skirt, ECWW, Fleece, Waffle top/bottom, OCP Coat, OCP Trousers, PTG Jacket/pants, PT Sweater.
Only display an empty hanger for a worn Service Coat, Lightweight Blues Jacket, or All-Weather Coat.
All-Weather Coat/Liner: Do not zip liner to coat. Button all except top. Buckle belt. If coat worn, display liner as if inside.
Lightweight Blue Jacket/Liner: Zip jacket fully, tuck zipper. Attach liner. If jacket worn, display liner as if attached.
Cardigan/Pullover Sweater: Button epaulets. Commissioned officers display rank.
Service Coat: Attach/pin all proper accoutrements on coat. Hang on 1 plastic hanger. If worn, leave hanger displayed.
Long Sleeve Blue Shirt/Blouse: Button all buttons. Group all similar shirts/blouses together.
Short Sleeve Blue Shirt/Blouse: Button all buttons except the top one. Group all similar shirts/blouses together.
Blue Trousers/Slacks: Button, zip, fasten. Drape inseam-to-inseem over hanger bar, cuffs/waistband even. Fly faces closet door; waistband left, legs right.
Blues Skirt: Button and zip. Hang on separate hanger, attached to left shoulder with pins. Skirt front faces left.
ECWW Jacket: Zip fully. Roll and secure hood. Snap pockets. Hang on one hanger. Tuck zipper string.
Fleece: Zip fully to the top. Hang on one hanger, pockets empty.
Waffle top/bottom (Optional): Hang on one hanger, displayed in the same manner as PTG jacket and pants.
OCP Coat/Top: Hang each on a separate hanger. Display as worn: all buttons fastened, including wrists. Group coats together.
OCP Trousers: Button all. Hang on separate hanger, draped inseam-to-inseem, cuffs/waistband even. Fly faces door; waistband left, cuffs right. Group trousers.
PTG Jacket/Pants: On one hanger, jacket (pockets empty, front unzipped, pocket zippers zipped) over folded pants (cuff zippers zipped). Fly faces door; waistband left, legs right.
PT Sweater: Hang on one hanger, to the right of the PTG items. The small front emblem must face the PTG.
(Optional) Waffle top/bottom: Hang on one hanger, display in the same manner as the PTG jacket and pants.
Pull laundry bag strings tight; tuck excess string to back. Only store dirty clothes/towels inside.
Ground to back corner opposite shoes. (Pos 4 grounds to front/door-side of Pos 1's closet. Pos 3 grounds to Pos 2's bag in other closet).
Shoes must be neat, clean/dust free, dry, and serviceable. Remove packaging.
Placement: Pos 1&2 heels grounded to entry wall. Pos 3&4 display in front of 1&2, heels grounded to dividing line (line set by aligning toes of first pair with closet door frame).
Quantity & Gaps: Max two pairs of a type. If a pair is removed, slide remaining shoes to fill gap.
Inspection Lacing (General): Tightly lace shoes/boots bottom to top, leave untied, tuck excess laces inside and out of sight.
Routine Order Lacing (Running Shoes Only): During routine order/sleeping, shoes may be loosely laced for easy entry.
Lacing (Combat Boots): Lace for fit using each eyelet. Tie single knot at lace ends. Tuck excess laces inside boot, out of sight.
Lacing (Low Quarters): Lace for fit using each eyelet. Do NOT knot ends. Tuck excess laces inside shoes, out of sight.
Lacing (Running Shoes): Lace for fit. Tie single knot at lace ends. Tuck excess laces inside shoe, out of sight.
(Optional) Shoe Inserts: Fresheners/shapers authorized if tucked inside. No cardboard/paper stuffing.
Shower Shoes: Must be entirely rubberized material; not leather, sandal, or sock-type.
Display Order: 1. Combat Boots 2. Low Quarters 3. Pumps (Optional) 4. Running Shoes 5. Shower Shoes.
